intro: Psychotria moninensis subsp. moninensis, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. It is a climbing shrub that typically grows in humid, shaded environments within lowland rainforests. The plant features small, elliptical leaves with a smooth texture and produces clusters of white or greenish-white flowers. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature, containing seeds that are dispersed by animals. The species is notable for its ornamental value and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
